H0.text: 1 day is about the length of a lunar cycle.

H1.text: A lunar cycle is about 1 week long.

H2.text: 28 days is about how long a lunar cycle is.

H3.text: 52 weeks is about how long a lunar cycle is.

A4.text: The average duration in modern times (mean synodic month) is 29.53059 days or 29 d 12 h 44 min 3 s

A5.text: The synodic month (Greek: συνοδικός, romanized: synodikós, meaning 'pertaining to a synod, i.e., a meeting'; in this case, of the Sun and the Moon), also lunation, is the average period of the Moon's orbit with respect to the line joining the Sun and Earth: 29 (Earth) days, 12 hours, 44 minutes and 2.9 seconds.
